column4: How can i stop update manager from updating a particular package?
I think update manager respects those settings...
i already tried the lock option and the packages appear pinned
but update-manager still updates the packages
what do you mean by "lock option"?
i oppened synaptic package manager, selected the package and chose the "lock version" option
i patched and rebuilt the package but it kept the same version of the package the system is trying to upgrade; could this be a problem to pinning?
you edited /etc/apt/preferences to pin your package version?
yes, but update-manager keeps trying to update it
but the package is trying to update as the same version as the package installed
ah, well when you patch your package, up the version (I append -1jrib1 or something similar...)
can I just rename the file?
the .deb that resulted from the patch
oh, no you need to update the changelog, run 'dch -i' in package-version directory
thank you very much for your help; after changing the changelog, rebuilding the package and installing it, i was able successfully do the pinning of the package
